meanings.definition: Cause to lose balance or equilibrium.
meanings.sent1: The sudden gust of wind disequilibrated the stack of books.
meanings.sent2: The earthquake disequilibrated the fragile vase on the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy kept disequilibrating the carefully arranged pillows.
meanings.sent4: His unexpected confession disequilibrated her emotions.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's graceful leap was so powerful that it seemed to disequilibrate the very air around her.

meanings.definition: Disturb the stability or balance of.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise from the construction site disequilibrated the peaceful atmosphere of the park.
meanings.sent2: The financial crisis disequilibrated the market, causing panic among investors.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child loved to disequilibrate the tower of blocks his sister built.
meanings.sent4: Her unexpected question disequilibrated the speaker's prepared speech.
meanings.sent5: The arrival of the unexpected guest disequilibrated the carefully planned party.
